properties.name: 30th Street Station
properties.description: Historic Beaux-Arts train station and a common arrival point into Philadelphia. A good place to start your day and get oriented.

properties.name: Schuylkill Banks
properties.description: Scenic waterfront trail along the Schuylkill River, perfect for a relaxed stroll and skyline views.

properties.name: The Garden Restaurant Café at the Barnes Foundation
properties.description: A calm café inside the Barnes Foundation complex, ideal for a sit-down brunch or coffee break along the Parkway.

properties.name: The Rocky Statue
properties.description: Classic photo-op at the base of the Philadelphia Museum of Art steps, made famous by the Rocky films.

properties.name: Reading Terminal Market
properties.description: Historic indoor market packed with local vendors, perfect for lunch and sampling Philly favorites.

properties.name: City Hall
properties.address: 1400 John F Kennedy Blvd, Philadelphia, PA 19107
properties.description: Imposing masonry City Hall at the center of Philadelphia, with ornate architecture and views of the surrounding downtown.

properties.name: LOVE Park
properties.address: 1501 John F Kennedy Blvd, Philadelphia, PA 19102
properties.description: Small urban park best known for the iconic LOVE sculpture—good for a quick photo stop between sights.

properties.name: Chinatown
properties.address: Arch St & N 10th St, Philadelphia, PA 19107
properties.description: Lively neighborhood with restaurants, bakeries, and shops—great for snacks, bubble tea, or an early dinner.

properties.name: Elfreth's Alley
properties.description: One of the oldest continuously inhabited residential streets in the U.S., with cobblestones and historic rowhouses.

properties.name: Philly Cheesesteak (Old City)
properties.description: Old City spots to try an iconic Philly cheesesteak after a day of sightseeing.

properties.name: Betsy Ross House
properties.description: Historic house museum dedicated to Betsy Ross, with a small courtyard and exhibits about early American history.

properties.name: Independence Hall
properties.description: UNESCO World Heritage Site where the Declaration of Independence and the U.S. Constitution were debated and adopted.

properties.name: Liberty Bell
properties.description: Iconic symbol of American independence housed in the Liberty Bell Center, just across from Independence Hall.

properties.name: Philadelphia Museum of Art
properties.description: One of the largest art museums in the U.S., with an extensive collection and iconic views over the Benjamin Franklin Parkway.

properties.name: Barnes Foundation
properties.description: World-renowned collection of Impressionist and modern art in a contemporary building along the Benjamin Franklin Parkway.

properties.name: The Franklin Institute
properties.description: Interactive science museum featuring hands-on exhibits, a planetarium, and the famous Giant Heart.

properties.name: Rodin Museum
properties.description: Intimate museum and garden with one of the largest collections of Auguste Rodin’s sculptures outside of Paris.

properties.name: African American Museum in Philadelphia
properties.description: Museum dedicated to interpreting and preserving the history and culture of African Americans, with a focus on Philadelphia and the region.

properties.name: Rittenhouse Square
properties.description: Lively park ringed by cafés, restaurants, and shops, ideal for people-watching or a quick break during the day.

properties.name: Washington Square
properties.description: Historic square with shaded paths and the Tomb of the Unknown Revolutionary War Soldier, a quieter green space near Independence Hall.

properties.name: Race Street Pier
properties.address: Race St & N Christopher Columbus Blvd, Philadelphia, PA 19123
properties.description: Tiered waterfront park beneath the Ben Franklin Bridge with great views of the river and Camden skyline.

properties.name: Cherry Street Pier
properties.address: 121 N Christopher Columbus Blvd, Philadelphia, PA 19106
properties.description: Converted historic pier with art installations, events, and riverfront views, often paired with Race Street Pier next door.

properties.name: South 9th Street Italian Market
properties.description: Historic open-air market with produce stands, specialty shops, and casual eateries reflecting Italian and Latinx communities.

properties.name: Spruce Street Harbor Park
properties.address: 301 S Christopher Columbus Blvd, Philadelphia, PA 19106
properties.description: Seasonal waterfront park with hammocks, floating gardens, lights, and food vendors — a relaxing place by the river.

properties.name: Penn's Landing
properties.address: 101 S Christopher Columbus Blvd, Philadelphia, PA 19106
properties.description: Historic waterfront area hosting events, river views, and seasonal attractions like ice skating or outdoor concerts.

properties.name: Mütter Museum
properties.description: A medical history museum featuring anatomical specimens, medical equipment, and exhibitions on health and science.

properties.name: Eastern State Penitentiary
properties.description: Historic prison known for its revolutionary design and audio tours led by Steve Buscemi. One of Philly's most popular attractions.

properties.name: Fairmount Water Works
properties.description: Historic 19th-century pumping station with riverfront views; a scenic stop behind the Art Museum.

properties.name: Independence Seaport Museum
properties.address: 211 S Christopher Columbus Blvd, Philadelphia, PA 19106
properties.description: Maritime museum featuring historic ships, exhibits on river history, and pier access along the waterfront.

properties.name: University of Pennsylvania Campus
properties.description: An Ivy League campus with historic and modern architecture, tree-lined walkways, and public art installations.

properties.name: Drexel University
properties.description: Urban university campus adjacent to UPenn, with modern academic buildings and student-centered open spaces.

properties.name: Temple University Center City (TUCC)
properties.description: Temple University's Center City campus offering graduate programs and continuing education in a convenient downtown location near City Hall. Great stop for prospective students exploring urban academic environments.

properties.name: Thomas Jefferson University (Center City Campus)
properties.description: Jefferson’s Center City campus is home to one of Philadelphia’s leading medical and health sciences universities. The area includes academic buildings, research facilities, and green courtyards woven into the heart of downtown—ideal for visitors exploring healthcare or biomedical programs.
